preparation:
1. Heat oil in a pan and add curry paste, fry for 1-2 minutes.
2. Add beef, shallots and garlic, and stir-fry until beef is browned.
3. Add palm sugar, tamarind paste, fish sauce, and peanuts, and stir-fry for another minute.
4. Add coconut milk and simmer until beef is tender, around 2-3 hours.
5. Garnish with chopped coriander and sliced red chillies, and serve with steamed rice.

1. Bring chicken stock to a boil in a pot over medium-high heat.
2. Add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal and chilli, and simmer for 5 minutes.
3. Add prawns and cook for another 2-3 minutes until pink and cooked through.
4. Stir in fish sauce, lime juice, sugar and roasted chilli paste.
5. Remove from heat and garnish with coriander and chopped green onions. Serve hot.
ingredients: 1 lb large prawns, peeled and deveined

preparation:
1. Soak the rice noodles in warm water until softened. Drain and set aside.
2. Heat oil in a wok and add garlic and shallots. Stir-fry until fragrant.
3. Add tofu, shrimp, and bean sprouts. Stir-fry until the shrimp turns pink.
4. Push the ingredients to one side and add the eggs. Scramble the eggs until set.
5. Add the rice noodles, tamarind paste, fish sauce, and sugar. Stir-fry until everything is well combined.
6. Add scallions and peanuts. Stir-fry for another minute.
7. Serve hot with lime wedges and cilantro leaves.
ingredients: Lime wedges and cilantro leaves, for serving

preparation:
1. In a pot, bring the chicken broth to a boil.
2. Add lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime leaves, and chili peppers. Boil for 2-3 minutes.
3. Add shrimp and mushrooms. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until the shrimp is pink.
4. Stir in fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
5. Remove from heat and stir in cilantro leaves. Serve hot.

1. Peel and shred the green papaya using a grater or mandoline. Set aside.
2. In a mortar and pestle, pound garlic and chili peppers into a paste.
3. Add green beans, tomatoes, and peanuts. Pound until the ingredients are slightly bruised.
4. Add the shredded papaya, fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar. Toss everything together.
5. Serve cold with extra peanuts and lime wedges.
ingredients: 1/2 cup green beans, cut into 2-inch pieces
Extra roasted peanuts and lime wedges, for serving

preparation:
1. Heat a pan over medium heat and add ground chicken. Cook until browned.
2. Add chopped shallots and garlic. Cook until fragrant.
3. Add chili powder, roasted rice powder, and fish sauce. Mix well.
4. Add chopped scallions, cilantro, and mint. Mix well.
5. Serve hot with sticky rice.

1. In a pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the green curry paste and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
2. Add the chicken and stir to coat with the curry paste. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until the chicken is browned.
3. Add the coconut milk, fish sauce, sugar, and bamboo shoots. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes.
4. Stir in the basil leaves and lime juice. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
5. Serve hot with steamed rice.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces

preparation:
1. In a pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the curry paste and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
2. Add the beef and stir to coat with the curry paste. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until browned.
3. Add the coconut milk, tamarind paste, fish sauce, sugar, potatoes, onions, and peanuts. Bring to a simmer and cook for 30-40 minutes or until the beef is tender.
4. Stir in the lime juice and cilantro leaves. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
5. Serve hot with steamed rice.
ingredients: 1 lb beef stew meat, cut into bite-sized pieces

preparation:
1. Rinse the sticky rice with water and soak for 30 minutes to 1 hour.
2. Drain the rice and place in a steamer basket lined with cheesecloth. Steam for 20-25 minutes or until cooked through.
3. While the rice is steaming, combine coconut milk, sugar, and salt in a saucepan. Heat over low heat until the sugar dissolves.
4. Once the rice is done, transfer it to a bowl and pour the coconut milk mixture over it. Stir well and let it sit for 10-15 minutes.
5. Peel and slice the mango into bite-sized pieces.
6. To serve, place a scoop of the sticky rice on a plate and top with sliced mango. Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and a sprig of mint, if desired.
ingredients: Toasted sesame seeds and mint leaves, for garnish
